intro: Pseudammi ehrenbergii, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has a compact, low-growing habit with hairy stems and leaves adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are typically tubular and are pollinated by bees and other insects. Pseudammi ehrenbergii is well-suited to dry climates and requires minimal water once established.
